intro: Aureolaria flava var. macrantha, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its flowers bloom in summer and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
